title: A protocol to induce expandable limb-bud mesenchymal cells from human pluripotent stem cells
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Thawing hPSCs
Timing: 60 min
Place a 60-mm culture dish on the bench.
Pre-warm StemFit medium at room temperature.
Add 5 mL of StemFit medium supplemented with 10 μM of Y-27632 to a 15-mL conical tube.
Remove the vial containing hPSCs from the liquid nitrogen, and immediately thaw the vial in 37°C water bath within 1 min or until only small ice particles remain.
Disinfect the vial with 70% EtOH and transfer the cell suspension to the conical tube prepared in step 2 by gentle pipetting (1–2 times).
Centrifuge the cells at 1,500 rpm for 5 min.
Aspirate the supernatant and resuspend the cells in 1 mL of StemFit medium supplemented with 10 μM Y-27632.
Stain the cells with Trypan blue (Gibco, 15250-061) and then count the cells using a cell counter.
To reduce human error in cell counting, we recommend the use of an automated cell counter (TC20 automated cell counter; size, 8–16 μm [Bio-Rad]).
Plate 1 × 104 cells/2 mL StemFit medium supplemented with 10 μM Y-27632 to one 60-mm culture dish.
Add 8 μL of iMatrix to a 60-mm culture dish with hPSCs.
Culture the dish at 37°C in 5% CO2 incubator.
On the next day, change to 3 mL of fresh StemFit medium without Y-27632 and iMatrix.
Stable culture of hPSCs under feeder-free condition
Timing: 1–8 weeks
Replace the culture medium with StemFit without Y-27632 and iMatrix every 24–48 h.
The cells should be observed every day.
StemFit medium is warmed at room temperature.
Until next passage, culture medium must be changed every 2 days. However, the medium color should change to orange or yellow even in 1 day, and the culture medium should be changed every day.
After 5–7 days culture, the cells should be passaged.

When the cells become 70%–80% confluent, passage is possible.
Aspirate the culture medium in the 60-mm culture dish and rinse the cells with 3 mL of PBS(-).
The amount of PBS(-) required may vary depending on the surface area of the culture apparatus.
Apply and spread 500 μL of 0.5 × TrypLE Select/EDTA, and then aspirate immediately.
Incubate the cells at 37°C for 5 min.
The cell surface does not dry out in approximately 5 min, and thus, cell viability is not a problem. However, if left longer than 5 min, the cells will dry out. Therefore, the cells should be incubated only for 5 min.
Strip cells by adding 500 μL of StemFit medium containing 10 μM of Y-27632 (See troubleshooting[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting] problem 1).
Dissociate cell clumps into single cells by gentle pipetting (approximately 10 times).
Too much pipetting increases the number of dead cells.
Transfer the cell suspension using a 1.5-mL microtube.
Determine the cell number and viability using any laboratory method. We count living cells by Trypan blue stain using cell counter.
Seed 1 × 104 cells/2 mL StemFit medium containing 10 μM of Y-27632, and then add 8 μL of iMatrix onto a 60-mm culture dish.
Gently agitate the culture dish to allow the cells to disperse uniformly.
Place the culture dish in a 5% CO2 incubator at 37°C.
Go back to step 12 for maintenance of the cells.
Critical: If hPSCs become overly confluent or bind each cell island colony, their pluripotent status and viability may be affected. Observe the cells periodically to ensure that they are undifferentiated and not overly confluent. If any differentiated cells or masses are observed, it is best to discard them and start all over again.
Differentiation of hPSCs into limb-bud mesenchyme (LBM)
Timing: 7 days

This section describes the production of limb-bud mesenchyme (LBM) from hPSCs based on previous reports (Yamada et al., 2021[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib2]). For selective differentiation from hPSCs to LPM, refer to Loh et al. (2016)[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib1]. Our protocol is developed based on previous researches and mimics the limb development process. The procedure of this section consists of 1) culture of hPSCs, 2) mid-primitive streak differentiation, 3) lateral plate mesoderm differentiation, and 4) LBM differentiation. This procedure should be performed on a 35-mm culture dish.
Seed an hPSC suspension (30,000 cells/1 mL) in a 35-mm culture dish. Cells should be suspended in StemFit medium containing 10 μM Y-27632 and 4 μL of iMatrix.
Culture for 24 h at 37°C in a 5% CO2 incubator.
Change to 1.5 mL of StemFit medium without 10 μM Y-27632 and iMatrix.
After culture for 48 h, aspirate the culture medium and wash the cells with PBS(-).
Apply 1.5 mL of the first differentiation medium (mid-primitive streak medium) into the 35-mm culture dish.
After culture for 24 h, aspirate the culture medium and wash the cells with PBS(-).
Apply 1.5 mL of the second differentiation medium (lateral plate mesoderm medium) into the 35-mm culture dish.
After culture for 24 h, aspirate the culture medium and wash the cells with PBS(-).
PBS(-) should be added slowly in consideration of the tendency to peel cells off.
Apply 1.5 mL of the third differentiation medium (LBM medium) into the 35-mm culture dish, and then culture for 48 h (See troubleshooting[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting] problem 2).
The medium should be added slowly because the cells might peel off.

Figure 1. Induction of LBM from hPSCs
(A) Cellular morphology should be observed during stepwise induction procedure.
(B) PRRX1 staining in LBM.

Critical: During the LBM differentiation procedure, observe the cell morphology at each point under the microscope to validate the cellular differentiation (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]). PBS(-) washing procedure prior to medium changes is necessary to achieve high efficiency of LBM induction. The quality of LBM can be assessed by the next FCM procedure instead of PRRX1 immunostaining.
Assess the quality of LBM
Timing: 60 min
We have identified the cell surface markers that define the human PRRX1+ LBM cells (Yamada et al., 2022[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib3]). This section describes a method enabling the assessment of LBM induction efficiency from hPSCs by checking the cell surface marker expression including CD44, CD140B, and CD49f.
After 48 h from changing to LBM medium, aspirate the culture medium and rinse the cells carefully with PBS(-).
Note: Cells are easily detached.
Apply 300 μL of Accutase (Nacalai Tesque, 12679-54), and then aspirate immediately.
Incubate the cells at 37°C for 5 min.
Strip the cells by adding 300 μL of ExpLBM medium.
Transfer the cell suspension to a 1.5-mL microtube.
Count the living cells by staining them with Trypan blue and using a cell counter.
Transfer the 1 × 105 LBM cells into a fresh 1.5-mL microtube, and then centrifuge the cells at 7,000 rpm for 1 min and then suspend the cell pellet with 100 μL of 2% FBS/PBS(-).
Add 0.5 μL of each antibody including APC-CD44 (good marker), BB700-CD140B (good marker), and FITC-CD49f (bad marker).
“Good condition” indicates that CD44 and CD140B are highly expressed with negative CD49f compared with the negative control as shown in Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]. On the other hand, “Bad condition” indicates that CD140B is not expressed or less expressed with partially positive CD49f.
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2098-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Flow cytometry analysis of LBM cells
Incubate the cell suspension for 1 h on ice.

Add 500 μL of 2% FBS/PBS(-) to the cell suspension.
Centrifuge the cells at 7000 rpm for 1 min.
Aspirate the supernatant and suspend the cell pellets with 2% FBS/ PBS(-) containing 50 ng/mL DAPI (Thermo Fisher Scientific, D3571).
Analyze the cells by flow cytometry. LBM cells are defined as CD44high CD140Bhigh CD49f (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]) (See troubleshooting[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting] problem 3–4).
Establishment and serial passage of ExpLBM cells
Timing: 5–7 days
This section describes the protocol that enables the stable proliferation of LBM cells (expandable LBM cells, ExpLBM cells) using the specific culture medium named ExpLBM medium. Our LBM expansion protocols which activated WNT and FGF signaling while inhibiting TGFβ signaling, recapitulated the developmental processes for limb-bud outgrowth following chondrogenesis.
Coat a fresh 60-mm culture dish with 2 mL of 4 μg/mL fibronectin diluted in PBS(-) for at least 30 min at 37°C in a 5% CO2 incubator.
Aspirate the fibronectin/PBS(-) and then add the ExpLBM medium to the coated dish.
Seed the 2 × 105 LBM cells suspended in a 3-mL ExpLBM medium onto fibronectin-coated culture dish.
Next day after plating, check the cell adhesion. If the coating is not in place, the cells will not adhere, and such cells should not be used for further experiments because we have never characterized cells that do not adhere.
Until next passage, culture medium should be changed every 2 days.
After 5–7 days culture, if the cells reached 70%–80% cell confluency, the cells should be passaged.
Assess the quality of ExpLBM cells
Timing: 60 min
This section describes a method that enables the prospective chondrogenic assessment of ExpLBM cells by checking its cell surface marker expression including CD90, CD140B, and CD82.
Aspirate the culture medium and rinse the cells with PBS(-).

Apply 400 μL of Accutase to a 60-mm culture dish, and then aspirate immediately.
Incubate the cells at 37°C for 5 min.
Strip the cells by adding 1,000 μL of ExpLBM medium.
Transfer the cell suspension to a 1.5-mL microtube.
Count the living cells by Trypan blue stain using cell counter.
Transfer the 1 × 105 ExpLBM cells into a new 1.5-mL microtube, and then centrifuge the cells at 7,000 rpm for 1 min and then suspend the cell pellet in 100 μL of 2% FBS/PBS(-).
Add 0.5 μL of each antibody including FITC-CD90 (good marker), BB700-CD140B (good marker), and APC-CD82 (bad marker).
Incubate the cell suspension for 1 h on ice.
Add 500 μL of 2% FBS/PBS(-) to the cell suspension.
Centrifuge the cells at 7,000 rpm for 1 min.
Aspirate the supernatant and suspend the cell pellets with 2% FBS/ PBS(-) containing 50 ng/mL DAPI.
Analyze the cells via flow cytometry. Chondrogenic ExpLBM cells are defined as CD90 high CD140B high CD82 low (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]) (See troubleshooting[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting] problem 5).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2098-Fig3.jpg
Figure 3. Flow cytometric analysis of ExpLBM cells
This assessment should be performed before 2DCI or 3DCI.
Critical: It is recommended that ExpLBM cells passaged more than three times be used for the following chondrogenic induction protocols (2DCI or 3DCI).
Cryopreservation of ExpLBM cells
Timing: 30 min
Resuspend 1 × 106 ExpLBM cell pellets with 300 μL of STEM-CELLBANKER (ZENOGEN PHARMA, CB045).
Dispense 300 μL of cell suspension to cryotubes, and then put them into BICELL (Nihon Freezer, BICELL).
Freeze cryotubes in BICELL at a −80°C freezer for 24 h, and then transfer them in a −80°C freezer or liquid nitrogen.
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2098-Fig4.jpg
Figure 4. Effect of freeze-thaw on ExpLBM cells
(A) Flow cytometric analysis of ExpLBM cells.
(B) Alcian blue staining after the 2DCI-based differentiation.

Critical: It is recommended that ExpLBM cells passaged more than four times be cryopreserved. The ExpLBM cells used in the paper were cryopreserved and used for chondrogenesis assay after freeze-thaw (Figure 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig4]).
Two-dimensional chondrogenic induction (2DCI)
Timing: 15 days
This section describes a method to perform the 2-dimensional (adhesive culture) chondrogenic induction protocol of ExpLBM cells. The description below is slightly modified from the original paper by Yamada et al. (2021)[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib2].
Prepare the ExpLBM cell suspension (70,000 cells/mL) using an ExpLBM medium containing 10% FBS.
Seed 200 μL of cell suspension (1.4 × 104 cells) into each well of a 96-well flat culture plate.
Culture for 3 days.
Wash the cells with PBS(-) and then add the fresh STEP 1 medium.
Culture for 6 days.
Change the medium 3 days after changing to STEP 1 medium.
Wash the cells with PBS(-) and then add the fresh STEP 3 medium.
Culture for 6 days.
Change the medium 3 days after changing to STEP 3 medium.
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2098-Fig5.jpg
Figure 5. Alcian blue staining after the 2DCI-based differentiation of ExpLBM cells
After 2DCI procedure, the cells are fixed and then stained with Alcian blue. PRRX1 low ExpLBM (Yamada et al., 2021[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib2]) shows lower intensities of Alcian blue staining.
Critical: PBS(-) washing procedure prior to medium changes is necessary to achieve high efficiency of chondrogenic induction. The chondrocyte differentiation can be assessed using Alcian blue staining (Figure 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig5]).
Three-dimensional chondrogenic induction (3DCI)
Timing: >54 days
This section describes a method to perform the 3-dimensional (floating culture) chondrogenic induction protocol of ExpLBM cells. The description below is slightly modified from the original paper by Yamada et al. (2021)[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib2].
Prepare an ExpLBM cell suspension (5 × 105 cells/mL) using STEP 1 medium.

Seed 200 μL of cell suspension (1 × 105 cells) into each well of a 96-well cell culture plate (CORNING, 7007, clear round bottom, ultralow attachment).
Centrifuge the plates at 2,000 rpm for 5 min (See troubleshooting[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting] problem 6).
Culture for 6 days.
Change the medium 3 days after changing to STEP 1 medium.
Replace the culture media with fresh STEP 2 medium.
Culture for 6 days.
Change the medium 3 days after changing to STEP 2 medium.
Replace the culture media with fresh STEP 3 medium.
Culture for 42 days (Figure 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig6]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2098-Fig6.jpg
Figure 6. Histology of cartilaginous particles generated after 3DCI-based differentiation of ExpLBM cells
Cartilaginous particles were generated from ExpLBM cells, fixed and stained with hematoxylin-eosin (HE), Alcian blue, Safranin O or Toluidine blue. Immnofluorecence staining; SOX9, COL2, ACAN or COL1.
Change the medium every 3 days.
(Option) Replace the culture media with fresh STEP 4 medium, and then culture for several weeks.
STEP 4 treatment induces histologically more matured cartilaginous particles.
